column1: C1: Verify homepage loads successfully and displays key elements
1. Browsers (Chrome 131.0.6778.266, Edge 132.0.2957.115, Firefox 134.0.1, Safari 20619.2.8.11.12) are installed, opened, and ready to use.
2. The user has a stable internet connection and the browser window is maximized to the default resolution (e.g., 1920x1080)
1      Link to amazon.com website.                                                 The website is loaded, and the content is visible.
2      Verify that the Amazon logo is displayed in the top left corner.            The Amazon logo is displayed in the top left corner.
3      Verify that the search bar is displayed in the center of the page.          The search bar is displayed in the center of the page.
4      Verify that the 'Hello, Sign in' link is displayed in the top right         The 'Hello, Sign in' link is displayed in the top right corner.
5      Verify that the main navigation menu with categories is                     The main navigation menu with categories is displayed.
6      Verify that the footer with copyright information and other links           The footer with copyright information and other links is
C2: Follow the link "Hello, sign in Account & Lists
Browsers (Chrome 131.0.6778.266, Edge 132.0.2957.115, Firefox 134.0.1, Safari 20619.2.8.11.12) are installed, opened, and ready to use.
The user has a stable internet connection and the browser window is maximized to the default resolution (e.g., 1920x1080)
The amazon.com website is loaded successfully.
The user is not logged in.
1      Click on the "Hello, sign in Account & Links" link in the top right         The user is redirected to the login/registration page.
C3: Press the button "Create your Amazon account"
The user is on the login/registration page.
1      Click the "Create your Amazon account" button.                              The registration form is displayed.
C4: Check validation messages for empty fields during registration
The user is on the registration form page.
1      Leave all the fields empty.                                                 No data is provided in the form.
2      Click the "Continue" button.                                                Validation messages appear for each for each empty field.
C5: Verify validation for incorrect email format
The user is on the registration form page.
1      Enter the invalid email in the email field.                                 The invalid email is displayed in the field.
2      Fill in the other fields with valid data.                                   The valid data is displayed in each required field.
3      Click the "Verify email" button                                             An error message appears.
C6: Check validation for already registered email
The user is on the registration form page.
The email address is already registered on Amazon.
1      Enter a registered email address.                                           The registered email is displayed in the email field.
2      Fill in the other fields with valid data.                                   The fields are filed out correctly.
3      Click the "Verify email" button.                                            An error message appears.
C7: Verify validation for password less than 6 characters
The user is on the registration form page.
1      Enter a password with fewer than 6 characters.                              The password is displayed less than 6 characters.
2      Fill in the other fields with valid data.                                   All the fields are filled out.
3      Click the "Verify email" button.                                            An error message appears.
The user is on the registration form page.
Access to the provided registration email client is available.
1      Enter valid data in all fields.                                             The valid data is displayed in all fields.
2      Click the "Verify email" button.                                            The user is redirected to the verify email address page.
3      Enter the code sent to the email box.                                       The code is accepted.
4      Enter a valid phone number.                                                 The code is accepted.
5      Press the "Create your Amazon account" button.                              The account is created successfully.
The user is redirected to their Amazon dashboard.
C9: Test editing and saving profile information
The user is logged in to their Amazon account.
1      Navigate to the "Your Account" section.                                     The list of provided functionality appears.
2      Click on the "Login & Security" section.                                    The profile data is displayed and able to change.
3      Edit profile details.                                                       The new data is accepted. A confirmation message appears.
C10: Test adding a new address
The user is logged in to their Amazon account.
1      Navigate to the "Your Addresses".                                           The "Your Address" page is displayed.
2      Click "Add Address."                                                        The "Add a new address" page is opened.
3      Enter valid address details.                                                The new address is added successfully.
C11: Verify user can log out successfully
The user is logged in to their Amazon account.
1      Hover on the "Hello, [User's Name]" link in the top right corner.           The menu appears
2      Click "Sign Out"                                                            The user is logged out successfully.
C12: Test login with registered account
The user has a registered account.
The user is on the login page.
1      Enter a valid email address and password.                                   No warnings or messages are displayed.
2      Click the "Sign In" button.                                                 The user is logged in successfully.
